org.obrel.filter

Class RelationCoupling<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.filter.RelationCoupling<T>

  • public class RelationCoupling<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the (loose) coupling of a relation with other sources or targets. The coupling is loose because it is not performed automatically but must be performed explicitly. This is done through the methods set() (update the coupled target from the relation) or get() (update the relation from the coupled source).

    Couplings are created with one of the coupling methods which are all based on couple(Relatable, RelationType, Consumer, Supplier). The Consumer function is used to update the target with the current relation value upon a call of set() and the Supplier will be invoked to update the relation target if get() is called.

    Couplings are stored in a meta-relation of the type COUPLINGS. If a coupling is no longer needed it can be discarded with remove(). To process multiple couplings at once the corresponding static methods like setAll(Relatable, Collection) can be invoked with multiple relation types at once.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static RelationType<java.util.Set<RelationCoupling<?>>> COUPLINGS
      The relation type that contains the couplings of a relation.

    • Method Detail

      • couple

        public static <T> RelationCoupling<T> couple(Relatable rRelatable,
                                             RelationType<T> rType,
                                             java.util.function.Consumer<T> fUpdateTarget,
                                             java.util.function.Supplier<T> fQuerySource)
        Couples a relation with a target and a source.
        Parameters:
        rRelatable - The parent object of the relation to couple
        rType - rRelationType The type of the relation to couple
        fUpdateTarget - A function that updates the coupled target (NULL for none)
        fQuerySource - A function that queries the coupled source (NULL for none)
        Returns:
        The new coupling
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If both functions are NULL

        Invokes get() for all couplings of relations with certain relation types.
        Parameters:
        rRelatable - The relatable to get the relations from
        rTypes - The relation types to invoke get() for

      • get

        public T get()
        Updates the relation from the value returned by the coupled source.
        Returns:
        The new relation value (or the existing if no source coupling has been set)

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Removes this coupling from the relation it has been registered on. This will remove it from the relation's set of COUPLINGS and disable it internally so that calls to set() and get() will no further have any effect on the relation.

      • set

        public void set()
        Updates the coupled target from the current relation value.
